solution:
Contact the vendor for a patch.

In addition to this patch, it is recommended that the documentation
and example code not be stored on production servers.
description:
The 'exprcalc.cfm' page in the version of Cold Fusion Application
Server running on the remote host allows an unauthenticated, remote
attacker to read arbitrary files and possibly delete or upload
arbitrary files as well.
synopsis: The remote application server is affected by multiple vulnerabilities.

plugin_name: Microsoft IIS advsearch.asp Direct Request Remote DoS
description:
The remote instance of IIS includes the sample site 'ExAir'. By
calling one of the included Active Server Pages, specifically
'/iissamples/exair/search/advsearch.asp', an unauthenticated, remote
attacker may be cause the web server to hang for up to 90 seconds (the
default script timeout) if the default ExAir page and associated DLLs
have not been loaded into the IIS memory space. This can be used to
render the site unusable.
synopsis: The remote web server is prone to a denial of service attack.

plugin_name: Microsoft IIS query.asp Direct Request Remote DoS
description:
The remote instance of IIS includes the sample site 'ExAir'. By
calling one of the included Active Server Pages, specifically
'/iissamples/exair/search/query.asp', an unauthenticated, remote
attacker may be cause the web server to hang for up to 90 seconds (the
default script timeout) if the default ExAir page and associated DLLs
have not been loaded into the IIS memory space. This can be used to
render the site unusable.
synopsis: The remote web server is prone to a denial of service attack.

plugin_name: Microsoft IIS search.asp Direct Request DoS
description:
The remote instance of IIS includes the sample site 'ExAir'. By
calling one of the included Active Server Pages, specifically
'/iissamples/exair/search/search.asp', an unauthenticated, remote
attacker may be cause the web server to hang for up to 90 seconds (the
default script timeout) if the default ExAir page and associated dlls
have not been loaded into the IIS memory space.
synopsis: The remote web server is prone to a denial of service attack.

solution:
Telnet to TCP port 30100 on the affected host, type '<KillServer>'
(without the quotes), and then press '<Enter>'.  This will stop the
NetSphere service. Then manually determine how the machine came to be
configured with a backdoor and clean it accordingly.
description:
The NetSphere backdoor is installed on the remote host.  By connecting
to it, a remote attacker can gain control of the affected system.
synopsis: A remote host contains a remote access trojan or backdoor.
